p: The PSQI questionnaire was used to measure the sleep quality of the study participants. There were 18 items that consisted of seven dimensions, including sleep quality, sleep duration, sleep latency, habitual sleep efficiency, sleep disturbances, use of sleeping×medications, and daytime dysfunction. Each dimension was scored from 0–3, and the total score, which was the sum of the scores from each dimension, ranged from 0–20. A higher score indicated lower sleep quality [ 20]. The Cronbach’s alpha for internal consistency of this questionnaire was previously determined to be 0.872.
